caseName: American Trucking Associations v. United States Environmental Protection Agency
caseNameFull: AMERICAN TRUCKING ASSOCIATIONS, INC. v. UNITED STATES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY, Commonwealth of Massachusetts, Intervenors
court: Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit
judge: Edwards, Garland, Ginsburg, Henderson, Randolph, Rogers, Sentelle, Silberman, Tatel, Wald, Williams

opinions.snippet: SILBERMAN, Circuit Judge, dissenting from the denial of rehearing en banc: The panel’s reliance on the nondelegation doctrine to reject EPA’s interpretation of section 109 of the Clean Ar Act is rather ingenious, but I regret that it seems to me to be fundamentally unsound. I do not think that doctrine can be employed to force an agency to narrow a broad legislative delegation from Congress.
